text-decoration: none;\">January 14, 2016 at 10:00 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_23MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCaptainji,<br />\n<br />\nSorry for the continuous disturbance but pls answer why Abhijith is not considered in malayalam calender?<br />\n<br />\nThank you.</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_23MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-61536494\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_23BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_23B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_24B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1TmA2Q8dmoI/UwiDv2Fb3eI/AAAAAAAApp4/Gfi3eJL51UI/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4230241667479037661\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_24M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/01/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_14.html?showComment=1452794498528#c4230241667479037661\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">January 14, 2016 at 11:31 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_24MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi ar,<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nall calenders on the planet are derived from the calender of asura MAYA DANAVA in sanskrit/ malayalam.<br />\n<br />\nMaya Danava was the father of mandodari, the beautiful wife of ravana.<br />\n<br />\nduryodhana fell in the pool of the palace made by maya danava at indraprasta. maya danava escaped to peru ( patala ) when Shiva got pissed off with him<br />\n<br />\nMaya Danava's sons Dundhubi and Mayavi were killed by the Vali.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/10/king-vali-and-queen-tara-of-ramayana.html<br />\n<br />\nMaya is the author of Surya Siddhantam.<br />\n<br />\nIn Bhagavad Gita, Krishna tells Arjun, that among Nakshtras he is Abhijit. Hence Abhijit Nakshatra is an auspicious time in the Hindu Calendar<br />\n<br />\nAbhijit is the Sanskrit name for Vega, the brightest star in the northern constellan of Lyra.<br />\n<br />\nAbhijit\u2019s longitude starts from 06\u00b0 40' to 10\u00b0 53' 20 in sidereal Capricorn i.e. from the last quarter of nakshatra Uttara Ash\u0101dh\u0101 to first 1/15 th part of Shravana.<br />\n<br />\nHence, Abhijit nakshatra is not a regular nakshatra with four padas or quarters, it serves as an intercalary asterism most of the times.<br />\n<br />\nEach of the 27 asterisms ( nakshatras) is feminine, only Abhijit is masculine.<br />\n<br />\nHowever , Moon ( Chandra) is said to have 27 (not 28) wives with whom he stays for one day in a sidereal lunar month.<br />\n<br />\nNakshatra is the term for lunar mansion in Hindu astrology. A nakshatra is one of 27 sectors along the ecliptic.<br />\nThe starting point for the nakshatras is the point on the ecliptic directly opposite to the star Spica called Chitr\u0101 in Sanskrit . It is called Mesh\u0101di or the \"first point of Aries\".<br />\n<br />\nIn Hindu sidereal astrology the first point of Aries remains aligned with Ras Hammel \"the head of the ram\", i.e. the Aries constellation.<br />\n<br />\nThe ecliptic is divided into each of the nakshatras eastwards starting from this point. The number of nakshatras reflects the number of days in a sidereal month (modern value: 27.32 days), the width of a nakshatra traversed by the Moon in about one day. Each nakshatra is further subdivided into four quarters (or padas).<br />\n<br />\nThese play a role in popular Hindu astrology, where each pada is associated with a syllable, conventionally chosen as the first syllable of the given name of a child born when the Moon was in the corresponding pada.<br />\n<br />\nHowever in the Atharva Veda 19.7( 5000 BC ) there are 28 nakshatras\u2014which includes Abhijit. The classical concept of a \"lunar mansion\" was first found in the Atharvaveda.<br />\n<br />\nIn the Atharvaveda (Shaunakiya recension, hymn 19.7) a list of 28 stars or asterisms is given, many of them corresponding to the later nakshatras:<br />\n<br />\n(1) K\u1e5bttik\u0101 (the Pleiads), (2) Rohin\u012b, (3) Mrigash\u012brsha, (4) \u0100rdr\u0101, (5) Punarvasu, (6) S\u016bnrit\u0101, (7) Pushya, (8) Bhanu (the Sun), (9) Aslesh\u0101, (10) Magh\u0101, (11) Sv\u0101ti (Arcturus), (12) Chitr\u0101 (Spica), (13) Phalgunis, (14) Hasta, (15) R\u0101dhas, (16) Vish\u0101kh\u0101, (17) Anur\u0101dh\u0101, (18) Jyeshth\u0101, (19) M\u016bla, (20) Ash\u0101dhas, (21) Abhijit, (22) Sravana, (23) Sravishth\u0101s, (24) Satabhishak, (25) Proshtha-padas, (26) Revati, (27) Asvayujas, (28) Bharani.<br />\n<br />\nThe first astronomical text that lists them is the Vedanga Jyotisha.<br />\n<br />\nThe creation of the nakshatras is attributed to Daksha. Maya Danava was a descendant of Danu, one of Kasyapa\u2018s 13 wives and a daughter of Dakhsa Prajapati.<br />\n<br />\nThey are personified as daughters of the deity and as wives of Chandra, the Moon god, or alternatively the daughters of Kashyapa, the brother of Daksha.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/maya-inca-aztec-civilizations-decoded.html<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_24MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_24BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_24B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_25B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1TmA2Q8dmoI/UwiDv2Fb3eI/AAAAAAAApp4/Gfi3eJL51UI/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5613966028619610796\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_25M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/01/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_14.html?showComment=1452794542095#c5613966028619610796\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">January 14, 2016 at 11:32 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_25MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nEach of the nakshatras is governed as 'lord' by one of the nine graha in the following sequence: Ketu (South Lunar Node), Shukra (Venus), Ravi or Surya (Sun), Chandra (Moon), Mangala (Mars), Rahu (North Lunar Node), Guru or Brihaspati (Jupiter), Shani (Saturn) and Budha (Mercury).<br />\n<br />\nThis cycle repeats itself three times to cover all 27 nakshatras. The lord of each nakshatra determines the planetary period known as the dasha, which is considered of major importance in forecasting the life path of the individual in Hindu astrology.<br />\n<br />\nIn Surya Siddhanta Maya Danava equated TIME with \"nakshatra\". Maya Danava wrote that a \"prana\" is a duration of 4 seconds. He then continues with a discussion of a number of time units with progressively long durations made up of the shorter time units all composed of a number of pranas. Amongst those time units are something he calls \"nakshatra.\"<br />\n<br />\nFor example, there are 15 pranas in a minute; 900 pranas in an hour; 21600 pranas in a day, 583,200 pranas in a nakshatra (month). Thus a nakshatra is a time unit with a duration of 27 days. This 27 day time cycle has been taken to mean a particular group of stars.<br />\n<br />\nThe relationship to the stars really has to do with the periodicity with which the Moon travels over time and through space past the field of the specific stars called nakshatras.<br />\n<br />\nHence, the stars are more like numbers on a clock through which the hands of time pass (the moon). Over time , this concept that nakshatra means a time unit has been lost and diverted to meaning a set of stars in the sky.<br />\n<br />\nThe Moon remains in each Nakshatra for approximately one day.<br />\n<br />\nThe nakshartas are now used as celestial markers in the heavens. When these were mapped into equal divisions of the ecliptic, a division of 27 portions was adopted since that resulted in a cleaner definition of each portion (i.e. segment) subtending 13\u00b0 20' (as opposed to 12\u00b0 51 3/7\u2019 in the case of 28 segments).<br />\n<br />\nIn the process, the Nakshatra Abhijit was left out without a portion. The Surya Siddhantha of Maya Danava concisely specifies the coordinates of the twenty seven Nakshatras<br />\n<br />\nHindu astrologers teach that when a child is born, they should be given an auspicious first name which will correspond to the child's Nakshatra. The technique for deducing the name is to see which nakshatra the Moon is in at the moment of birth; this gives four possible sounds.<br />\n<br />\nA refinement is to pick one sound out of that four that relates to the Pada or division of the Nakshatra. Each Nakshatra has four Padas and four sounds and each Pada is of equal width. The upper word is the nakshatra, the constellation of stars (asterisms) nearest to the moon on that day.<br />\n<br />\nMALAYALAM/ SANSKRIT<br />\nAswati/ Aswini<br />\nBharani/ Bharani<br />\nKartika/ Krttika<br />\nRohini/ Rohini<br />\nMakayiram/ MrgaShirsha<br />\nThiruAthira/ Ardra<br />\nPunartham /Punarvasu<br />\nPooyam/ Pushya<br />\nAyilyam/ Aashlesha<br />\nMakam/ Magha<br />\nPooram/ Poorva Phalguni<br />\nUthram/ Uthara Phalguni<br />\nAtham/ Hastam<br />\nChithira/ Chitra<br />\nChothi/ Swathi<br />\nVisakham/ Visakha<br />\nAnizham/ Anuradha<br />\nKetta/ Jyeshta<br />\nMoolam/ Moola<br />\nPooradam/ PoorvaAshadha<br />\nUthradam/ UtharaAshada<br />\n(Abhijit)/ (Abhijit)<br />\nThiruOnam/ Shravana<br />\nAvittam/ Shravishta<br />\nChathayam/ Shathabhisha<br />\nPooruruttathi/ PoorvaBhadrapada<br />\nUthrttahi /UtharaBhadrapada<br />\nRevathi/ Revathi<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_25MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_25BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_25B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_26B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; border-bottom-width: 0px; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1TmA2Q8dmoI/UwiDv2Fb3eI/AAAAAAAApp4/Gfi3eJL51UI/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2501415959257901599\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_26M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/01/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_14.html?showComment=1452794572561#c2501415959257901599\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">January 14, 2016 at 11:32 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_26MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 2-<br />\n<br />\nThe period of revolution of the moon is not an exact integer multiple of the period of rotation of the Earth: it is 27.3 days. Hence a 28th nakshatra (Abhijit) with an unusually short interval (about eight hours) is inserted to compensate for this.<br />\n<br />\nInitially, the zodiac was grouped in 12 Rashis for convenience, however the ancient seers have farther subdivided the heavens into 27 Nakshatras or star constellations for the call of precession. These constellations or the Nakshatras emerged as one of the most important components in Astrology.<br />\n<br />\nVedic astrology identifies each constellation with a star. The 360 degree division of the sky is therefore further divided into 27 subdivision of 13.20 degrees identified with 27 stars. Each of these Nakshatras are farther subdivided into four Padas or quarters of 3 degrees and 20 minutes.<br />\n<br />\nTherefore the first Rashi, Mesha, which has 30 degrees, contains the entire 4 Padas (13:20\u2032) of the 1st star constellation Ashwini, the entire 4 Padas (13:20\u2032) of the 2nd star constellation Bharani and the 1st Pada (3:20\u2032) of the third star constellation Krittika. In this manner, each Rashi comprises of 9 Padas<br />\n<br />\nThese Nakshatras are broadly classified under the three heads of Deva (divine), Nara (human) and Rakshasa (Demonic).<br />\nNo/ Nakshatras /Astronomical Name/ Deity/Ruling Planet Starting Dasha/ Colour<br />\n28 /Abhijit / Vega / Brahma / Sun / Brownish yellow<br />\n<br />\nAbhijit Muhurat is AN auspicious time during midday of about 48 minutes. Abhijit Muhurat is capable of destroying innumerable Doshas and it is considered one of the best Muhurats to start all sort of auspicious works.<br />\n<br />\nLord Shiva killed demon Tripurasur during Abhijit Muhurat. Abhijit Muhurat is also not suitable for Manglik activities like marriage and Upanayana ceremonies. The duration of the abhijit muhurat lingers up to 48 minutes. 24 minutes before and after the sidereal time is called the abhijit muhurat.<br />\n<br />\nAs the abhijit muhurat is auspicious people opt for this muhurat to perform their work. Abhijit muhurat safeguards a work even if the day is inauspicious. Astrologers say that if in any condition an auspicious work does not have a good muhurat then you can perform their work on the auspicious abhijit muhurat.<br />\n<br />\nHence the 28th intercalary nakshatra to compensate for the sidereal month being<br />\neight hours more than 27 days is Abhijit (alpha, epsilon and zeta<br />\nLyrae - Vega ) - between Uttarashada and Sravana.<br />\n<br />\nEvery Zodiac sign is copied from Malayalam / Sanskrit\u2014THIEVES !<br />\nChingam/ Leo<br />\nKanni/ Virgo<br />\nThulam/ Libra<br />\nVrshchikam/ Scorpio<br />\nDhanu/ Bow(Sagittarius)<br />\nMakaram /Sea-monster(Capricorn or Goat)<br />\nKumbham/ Water Pot(Aquarius)<br />\nMeenam/ Fish(Pisces)<br />\nMedam/ Ram<br />\nIdavam/ Bull(Taurus)<br />\nMidhunum / Couple(Gemini)<br />\nKarkkadakam/ Crab(Cancer)<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_109M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/08/imhotep-patron-saint-of-freemasons-capt.html?showComment=1452827607656#c8465439656578794994\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">January 15, 2016 at 8:43 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_109MC\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttp://www.thenewsminute.com/article/why-sabarimala-has-restrictions-women-rahul-easwar-explains-37674<br />\n<br />\nRAHUL EASHWAR KNOWS <b>SHIT </b>ABOUT HINDUSIM . .<br />\n<br />\nROTHSCHILD CREATED THE FAKE STORY OF ATTUKAL --<br />\n<br />\nHERE ARE THE LIES FROM WIKIPEDIA<br />\n<br />\nQUOTE: Attukal Bhagavathy is supposed to be the divinised form of Kannaki, the famous heroine of Chilapathikaram, written by Elenkovadikal, the Tamil Poet. The story goes that after the destruction of ancient city of Madurai, Kannaki left the city and reached Kerala via Kanyakumari and on the way to KODUNGALLUR took a sojourn at Attukal. UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/03/kodungallur-bharani-festival-capt-ajit.html<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/sabarimala-makaravilakku-three-light.html<br />\n<br />\nPUT THIS COMMENT IN RAHUL EASHWARs AND RSS WEBSITE.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the wonders of\nSanatana Dharma is that Hindus are rarely jealous of other people.&nbsp; The Hindu way of life , does NOT give any importance\nto material pursuits. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fundamentals of\nDharma as per the Bhagwat Gita are-- respect, truth, grace, restraint, love,\nnon-violence, restraint, lack of jealousy and greed, knowledge of self and\nausterity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Matsarya (Jealousy )\nhas the power to destroy.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Hinduism Matsarya is\none of the six Arishadvarga &nbsp;( passions )\nof mind or desire: kama (lust), krodha (anger), lobh (greed), moha\n(attachment), mada or ahankar (pride) and matsarya (jealousy);the negative\ncharacteristics of which prevent man from attaining moksha . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no greater\npunishment than the primal emotion of jealousy,&nbsp;\nfor it is the most potent cause of unhappiness.&nbsp; Jealousy causes negative feelings and misery\nwhich corrode your innards like rust to iron.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jealousy is a raw human\nemotion created when a person feels insecure about his value to other\npeople.&nbsp; It consists of negative\nfeelings, revolving around&nbsp;&nbsp; fear and\nanxiety over an anticipated loss .&nbsp; When\nyou compare yourself to others , it will lead to destructive thinking.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A true Hindu will NOT\nmake a home for others to gape at. His home is for his wife and children to\nlive in happiness and harmony.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Have you noticed how Chutney Marys and Pickle Johns people go on Facebook and feel miserable. For all and\nsundry are waxing lyrical of ZE good life.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They have put in rosy pictures of their fancy holidays , how great a\nparty they held with hundreds of cheering well wisher friends , how their child\ncame first in some bullshit event , the expensive diamond ring presented by the\nhusband ( it would be a fake actually ) ,&nbsp;\nhow loving and smart their pet dog is , their new SUV, their dream\npromotion at the work place- the drinks are on me -- BLAH BLAH.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You start comparing and this plays up in\nyour chattering mind.&nbsp; Everybody in your\ncircle is having a fabulous time but you.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jealousy surfaces and\nthey feel frustrated with their own lot. . And believe me , they are comparing\nthemselves with their true friends and relatives\u2014 and they are supposed to feel\ngood at their \u201csuccess\u201d instead of turning green with envy . They get depressed\n, and short changed at being forced by destiny to take in the short end of the\nstick,&nbsp; not knowing that everything on\nFacebook is sugar coated bull.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you are constantly\ncomparing yourself to the Joneses, you\u2019ll suffer unintended consequences.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jealousy does not do\nyou any good . If you feel needlessly unhappy, and are having negative thoughts, and have started dishing out fake smiles , is it worth being on Facebook?.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Facebook is a forum\nwhere you give others the power to make you jealous and feel miserable. Unless\nyou are ze guy who holds 3 aces all the while. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You do NOT find Hindus\nhankering to be in PAGE 3.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Friend or no, envy is an\noverwhelming emotion. When you are jealous you count the other fellow's\nblessings instead of your own, and lose your peace of mind\u2014rather burn up\ninside.. It is in the character of very few men to honor without envy a friend\nwho has prospered. The sure mark of one born with noble qualities, is being\nborn without envy.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of the seven deadly\nsins, only envy aint no fun at all. Anger, resentment and jealousy doesn't\nchange the heart of others-- it only changes yours. The jealous are troublesome\nto others, but a greater torment to themselves.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jealousy is bred in doubts.&nbsp; When\nthose doubts change into certainties, then the passion either ceases or turns\nabsolute madness.&nbsp; When jealous behavior\ngoes completely haywire, it can erupt into aggression and possibly turn\nviolent. Unhealthy jealousy uses up precious energy and steals quality time .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Self worth comes with\nself appreciation and love.&nbsp; Hindus who\nhave happy homes , are secure with themselves, rarely let jealousy get in the\nway .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Hinduism, envy is a\ndisastrous emotion.&nbsp; Hinduism maintains\nthat anything which causes the mind to lose balance with itself , leads to\nmisery.&nbsp; Envy cannot coexist with truth\nand spiritual wisdom.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanatana Dharma gives\nlot of importance to COUNTING OUR BLESSINGS rather than our sorrows.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Raja Yogi destroys the Vritti by\n\"Yogah Chittavritti-nirodhah.\" He destroys all Sankalpas of jealousy\nby introspection, careful watch and meditation. He adopts another method of\n\"Pratipaksha Bhavana\" by cultivating the opposite virtues of\njealousy, viz., nobility or magnanimity (Udarata). Jealousy is the result of\npetty-mindedness. If nobility is supplanted, jealousy will die of itself.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One who does not envy\nbut is a compassionate friend to all ... such a devotee is very dear to Me. - <b>Lord Krishna in Bhagavad Gita, Chapter 12,\nVerse 15. 4000 BC<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/--8v9vB7kJ9k/VpixR7YgwcI/AAAAAAABDU8/5P2JXUUL6V0/s1600/doweenload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--8v9vB7kJ9k/VpixR7YgwcI/AAAAAAABDU8/5P2JXUUL6V0/s400/doweenload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hinduism has always\nbeen at the receiving end because of the emphasis on sustaining Dharma and &nbsp;emphasis on ahimsa.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white invader made the Hindu self\nloathing by injecting immoral poison into our Vedas / Upanishads . &nbsp;They took away the originals of our scriptures\n. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today you cannot trust\nany duplicate , photocopy and scan. If any manuscript is LESS THAN 400 YEARS AGE BY CARBON TESTING , you must NOT trust it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: scriptures.&nbsp; They will never ever\ndiscuss anything which exudes glorious &nbsp;sublime content.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An India without Hindu\ndharma would not be India at all. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hindu dharma has shored\nup the timeless spirit of India.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below: This planet's largest pilgrimage --for 9th avatar of Lord none;\">January 17, 2016 at 7:16 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_167MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi vs,<br />\n<br />\nnobody knows who gave birth to ayyappa.<br />\n<br />\nall we know is that he was a beautiful boy baby found playing with tiger cubs on the banks of the pampa ( panthalam kingdom ).<br />\n<br />\nhe disappeared as a young pre-teenager, because he felt that his foster queen mother look on him as a challenger to the throne . &nbsp;initially she loved him, as she was childless , but when she conceived a boy child, she only pretended to love ayyappa .<br />\n<br />\nthe queen pretended to be ill and asked ayyappa to bring her the milk of a tigeress. promptly he went out of the palace and came back riding a mother tigress with small cubs running behind.<br />\n<br />\nthe king knew that ayyappa would now go away -- and tried his best to make him stay.<br />\n<br />\nAYYAPPA SWORE THAT HE WILL NOT MARRY AND HAVE CHILDREN--SO THAT THE QUEEN IS FURTHER ASSURED OF FUTURE ROYAL BLOODLINES.<br />\n<br />\nthen he disappeared.<br />\n<br />\nthose days the pharoahs of egypt were indians .<br />\n<br />\na young man \"from the east\" suddenly appeared as an advisor to the pharoah around 4600 years ago. &nbsp;he would put U vaishnava marks on his body with holy ash.<br />\n<br />\nimhotep was a SUPERMAN .<br />\n<br />\nthere was nothing he could NOT do. &nbsp;the people of egypt respected imhotep as a GOD-- ( the pharoah too ). &nbsp;he used leeches ( product of samudra manthan ) for vaccinations. &nbsp;he used gomutra for various cures . his architecture has vaastu inherent.<br />\n<br />\nhe died unmarried.<br />\n<br />\nI AM THE FIRST ON THE PLANET TO SAY AYYAPPA BECAME IMHOTEP-- AFTER DOZENS OF UNIQUE PATTERN MATCHING.<br />\n<br />\nthis is just one of my more than 10,000 revelations.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/imhotep-patron-saint-of-freemasons-capt.html<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_168b+seedMrpuD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_168b+seedMrpuD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/01/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_14.html?showComment=1453041223069#c7941194712651244350\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">January 17, 2016 at 8:03 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_168MC\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nSOMEONE JUST ASKED ME ABOUT CREMATIONS.<br />\n<br />\nNEVER MIND THE LIES OF ROTHSCHILD MEDIA , IN ANCIENT DAYS EVERY HERO AND KING WAS CREMATED ( NOT BURIED ). GREEKS/ ROMANS/ VIKINGS etc<br />\n<br />\nviking heores wanted to be cremated in their own boats.<br />\n<br />\nachilles the greek was cremated on a high platform , with 17 days of mourning. his ashes were merged with his homosexual friend patroclus in a golden urn .<br />\n<br />\nthe creation of judaism, christianity and islam caused cremation to be substituted by burial.<br />\n<br />\nancient pharoahs wanted to be BURIED in meditative posture as indian holy men.<br />\n<br />\nmummification inside pyramids only started later--with rothschild historians adding masala.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_169M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/09047675409868148466\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">san</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/01/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_14.html?showComment=1453042914276#c5859229172070184929\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">January 17, 2016 at 8:31 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_169MC\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n\"achilles ashes were merged with his homosexual friend patroclus\"<br />\nwow captain! that is what i call true love nay lobe :). was he a skilled fighter or is it all just masala like Alexander the dwarf?</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_172B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3158692791206181102\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_172MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi s,<br />\n<br />\nGreeks are proud of warrior Achilles, like how we are proud of warrior Arjuna. Both have inspired generations.<br />\n<br />\nBUT ACHILLES OF HOMERs EPIC ILIAD WAS NOT REAL\u2014 WHILE ARJUNAOF MAHABHARATA WAR WAS REAL.<br />\n<br />\nAchilles who was shot under his foot ( heel area ) \u2013is just a pathetic copy of Krishna being shot under the foot ( weak point due to Maharishis Durvasa\u2019s curse ).<br />\n<br />\nAchilles\u2019s mother held him by his heel and dipped him in the magic river.<br />\nAfter the great Kuruskhetra war , that nearly destroyed humankind and humanity alike, the battle field lay still ! The battle was over , and the vast field lay blood soaked and strewn with bodies of kings, princes and soldiers .<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nThere was no mood for hip-hip huzzah among the surviving Pandava army. Most stood sullen and stunned by the gruesome scene .They were devastated at the destruction that a single war had caused.<br />\n<br />\nStunned and speechless, they scanned the battle field to check out for survivors among the lifeless.<br />\n<br />\nGandhari with her blind fold still in place was crying over her dead sons. She was rambling in extreme grief , her speech slurred. \u201cDuryodhana , my son , open your eyes. speak to me my first born\u2026A hundred did we bear, all fine and proud. Was it for such a foolish end? Her husband, the blind king Dritharashtra stood by, looking lost.<br />\n<br />\nThe Pandavas and Krishna hurried over to Gandhari and Dritharashtra, to offer their respects, apologies and condolences.<br />\n<br />\nSanjaya, the king\u2019s escort, gently bent down to Gandhari, to inform the blindfolded woman of the arrival of the Pandavas and Krishna. Her grief turned to a burning rage .<br />\n<br />\nShe went up to Krishna and screamed .The Pandavas recoiled in fear.<br />\n<br />\nGandhari cried out to Krishna \u201cYou, who I worshipped as Vishnu and You, known as an avatar of the supreme godhead. Aren\u2019t you ashamed of your doings? Could you not have averted this war with your divine will and power? Is this how you answer my prayers? Ask your mother, Devaki, the pain of losing a child. She had seven of her children being killed at birth and now I have seen a hundred sons of mine being butchered to death\u201d .<br />\n<br />\nKrishna laughed gently.<br />\n<br />\nShe now vented her steam \u201c Oh mocking god , If my years of Vishnu bhakthi have been true, and if I have been true to my husband with this blindf, then, may you die in 36 years from today. May Dwaraka be floodeld , may every one of your Yadava kin perish by killing each other, just as you made the kins of Kuru kill one another. May the Yadavas perish \u201c<br />\n<br />\nSuddenly the gravity of her words dawned on her . She has indeed been true to her devotion to Vishnu and to her blindfold . Her curse would take effect . Her anger vapourised and she fell at Krishna\u2019s feet for foregiveness .<br />\n<br />\nKrishna smiled and gently lifted her up. He whispered \u201c Oh mother , your curse will take effect, not only because of your true devotion towards me and your husband, but also due to the ever changing sands of time. In the mean time, let\u2019s attend to the tending of the dead and sending them away on their journey to the heavens.\u201d Lord Krishna walked past the stunned Pandavas.<br />\n<br />\nAfter the war was over Krishna was himself contemplating the end of the snooty Yadav race. They were very powerful under the protection of lord Krishna so no external force could defeat them. If the Yadavas were unharnessed , they will become a burden to the planet. Krishna realized the gravity of the situation and the importance of bringing the destruction of his own beloved race. Gandhari\u2019s curse came at the right time as if on divine cue.<br />\n<br />\nDays flew by after the coronation of Yudhishtra as the king of Hasthinapur. Krishna went back to Dwaraka to rule over the prosperous kingdom. Slowly but steadily the the curse of Gandhari bore fruit.<br />\n<br />\nThe pompous Yadavas shed their conduct, morals, scruples and humility. One incident sealed their fate. Some great sages were on pilgrimage and they stopped by at Dwarka to meet Krishna and Balarama.<br />\n<br />\nThe Yadavas, which included Bhodakas, Vrishnis, Kekeyas and Andakas, wre now at the peak of wanton uncouth behavior.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_172MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_172BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_172B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_173B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1TmA2Q8dmoI/UwiDv2Fb3eI/AAAAAAAApp4/Gfi3eJL51UI/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c78969696553899623\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_173M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/01/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_14.html?showComment=1453049499283#c78969696553899623\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">January 17, 2016 at 10:21 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_173MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nA bunch of Yadava boys decided to tease the sages. They dressed Samba, the handsome son of Krishna as a woman and tied pillows on his stomach to make the woman look pregnant.<br />\n<br />\nThey approached the sages and asked them to predict whether the 'lady' would give birth to a boy or a girl. The dismayed sages saw through this charade and were shocked at this lack pf respect.<br />\n<br />\nIn anger, on of the sages cursed them saying that the disguised boy will give birth to a lump of iron which will destroy the entire Yadava race. The Yadavas, again showed extreme disrespect and responded with sarcasm, instead of an apology.<br />\n<br />\nThere was a pall of fear and impending doom the next day when Krishna\u2019s son Sambha developed labour pains and soon delivered an iron mace . They immediately rushed with the mace to Akroora and Ugrasena and in the presence of Krishna himself; they narrated the weird tide of events.<br />\n<br />\nKrishna knew the events which would transpire in future , and kept quiet. Seeing Krishna silent , Akroora cried \u201cGrind the mace to a fine powder and cast it into the ocean.\u201d The Yadavas nodded and ran to comply.<br />\n<br />\nAkroora looked with intent at Krishna, his eyes full of questions. Krishna simply smiled back. \u201cUncle, the Kala Chakra is now in motion . Sambha has played his part perfectly.\u201d<br />\n<br />\nHe left without another word, leaving both of them bewildered.<br />\n<br />\n\u201cWhat did he mean by that?\u201d asked Ugrasena. \u201cI can tell you that, father.\u201d Ugrasena turned around to the source of voice - Rukmini. \u201cThirty six year ago, Krishna prayed to Shiva for a son like him\u2014a god of detruction -does that mean anything?\u201d<br />\n<br />\nThe time for gandari\u2019s curse to take effect had arrived.<br />\n<br />\nOutside the palace, the Yadavas had obeyed Akroora\u2019s command and they ground the iron mace into fine powder\u2014except for a stubborn triangular piece looking like an arrow head. It was too hard to grind . The Yadavas threw everything into the sea.<br />\n<br />\nThe fear disappeared and they went back to their wanton and rowdy behavior .<br />\n<br />\nThey started to drink heavily and were intoxicated throughout the day. Time rolled by. The triangular piece of the mace was swallowed by a fish. The fish was caught by a hunter, who upon finding the piece in the fish\u2019s entrails immediately used it to craft a fine poisonous arrow.<br />\n<br />\nThe fine powder, on the other hand, washed back ashore and deposited itself by the beautiful coast of Dwaraka. A certain sharp serrated grass grew in lush abundance in the area where the powder was deposited.<br />\n<br />\nEverything was set and in place for the final showdown.<br />\n<br />\nAfter 36 years of Mahabharat war, evil omen started to appear in the Dwaraka city. The Sudarshana chakra, Panchajanya shankh, the chariot of lord Krishna and the plough weapon of Balarama just disappeared from earth. One day, the Yadavas gathered on the beach. The liquor that they drank made them lose their senses completely.<br />\n<br />\nThey started teasing one another, bringing up the gory pasts and gruesome mistakes of each other. Satyaki and Krithavarma acted as the starting points of the doom of Dwaraka. Satyaki had fought on Pandava\u2019s side in the battle of Kurukshetra and Krithavarma, on the Kaurava side. They taunted one another, bringing back memories of the horrific war where the Pandavas cheated against the rules of war , aided and abetted by Krishna.<br />\n<br />\nIn a fit of rage, Satyaki, jumped on Krithaverma and cut his head off. The friends of Krithavarma pounced on Satyaki and a great mass brawl followed. Pradyumna, the son of Krishna, innocent though he was, found himself in the thick of the fight and was killed. As they have come to the sea shore for a pleasure, they did not carry any weapons along with them. They saw the long grown sharp serrated grass in abundance along the sea shore. They picked up the grass stems and beat and killed each other. The whole area was soaked in red blood.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_173MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_173BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_173B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_174B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; border-bottom-width: 0px; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1TmA2Q8dmoI/UwiDv2Fb3eI/AAAAAAAApp4/Gfi3eJL51UI/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5929740606803834676\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_174M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/01/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_14.html?showComment=1453049637388#c5929740606803834676\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">January 17, 2016 at 10:23 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_174MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 2-<br />\n<br />\nThose grass stems are nothing but blades made of the powder of the same lump of Iron born to Samba. The curse of saints had borne fruit. Each blade of grass became a mace, smashing into the Yadavas, killing them instantly. Except Krishna, all Yadavas were killed. Krishna\u2019s charioteer Daruka and another one called Babhru only survived.<br />\n<br />\nKrishna knew that the time for him to shed his earthly avatar had come. Krishna knew the only way for someone to kill him was by wounding his foot. He remembered the curse of Maharishi Durvasa, which left his foot vulnerable. Krishna laid down under a tree and went into Yoga Samadhi. At that time a hunter Jara entered that forest. That hunter misunderstood the moving foot of Krishna as a lurking deer and shot a lethal arrow that pierced into Krishna\u2019s feet. As soon as the hunter reached Krishna, he realised his mistake and pleaded the lord for forgiveness. Lord Krishna consoles him and tells him how his death was inevitable and things are going as per divine plan .<br />\n<br />\nKrishna says that in his previous birth as Lord Rama in the Tretayuga, Rama killed Vaali (Sugreeva's brother) from behind. So, Krishna has now reaped the price for the same through Jara who was king Vaali in his previous birth.<br />\n<br />\nSuch was the Dharma thatt, even for the Ruler of the Universe, the laws of Karma remain the same. Hence, lord Krishna left the mortal world.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/10/king-vali-and-queen-tara-of-ramayana.html<br />\n<br />\nSAALA HOMER KA BULLSHIT ILLIAD KIDHAR \u2013 HUMAARA MAHABHARATA KIDHAR.<br />\n<br />\nLIKE COMPARING A DIM BATTERY TORCH WITH THE BLAZING SUN.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3654432283823903681\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\">REMEMBER VEDAS DOES NOT HAVE AN AUTHOR-- THEY WERE REVEALED TO SEERS , WHO PASSED IT ON ORALLY.</span><br />\n<br style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\" />\n<span style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; Meanwhile some additional questions have arisen which please, answer when you answer my first questions.<br />\n1. What is the meaning of \u201cpeople\u201d in \u201cpeople\u2019s war\u201d? Does it mean war on behalf of India\u2019s millions, or the Negroes in East, South or West Africa, or the Negroes of America, or all of them? Are the Allies engaged in such a war?<br />\n2. Are the finances of the Communist Party, represented by you, subject to public audit? If they are, may I see them?<br />\n3. It is stated that the Communist Party has actively helped the authorities to arrest leaders and organizers of labour strikes during the last two years.<br />\n4. The Communist Party is said to have adopted the policy of infiltrating the Congress organization with a hostile intent.<br />\n5. Is not the policy of the Communist Party dictated from outside?<br />\nYours sincerely,<br />\nM. K. GANDHI\"<br />\nGandhi further wrote \u201d Many honest Congressmen come to me or write to me from the various provinces that communists have no principles save of keeping their party alive and beating their opponents with any stick that came to their hands.\u201d (Letter no 721, Page no 413)<br />\n<br />\nSA Dange had written that th Commies \u201c had decided to establish a network of underground combat cells all over India during the next two years, to be used in case of need\u201d<br />\n<br />\nWE CALL THIS \u201cSLEEPER CELLS \u201c. 7 astral layers corresponding to the 7 human chakras.<br />\n<br />\nthe topmost layer ( 7th ) is vaikunta ( corresponding to sahasrara chakra , where shiva shati merges after kundalini raise into a 6 pointed star )<br />\n<br />\nonly souls who attained MOKSHA ( NIL karmic accumulated baggage ) can merge with GOD ( brahman -the morphogenetic consciousness field ) of the 7th astral layer, after death.<br />\n<br />\nthe dead bodies of such people who attained MOKSHA ( jivan mukkt while living on earth ) are BURIED.<br />\n<br />\njivan mukht sages like apollonius can do astral travel. their soul leave the body takes a ride and them re-enters the body.<br />\n<br />\nyou are NOT what you see in the mirror.<br />\n<br />\nYOU are a just tiny BALL OF ENERGY within you. this ball ( soul ) can never be destroyed .<br />\n<br />\nwe do namaste to the GREAT soul in the other man<br />\n<br />\nas long as you have accumulated baggage of karma , your soul is parked in one of the bottom 6 astral layers .<br />\n<br />\nyou ( your soul ) is re-inducted back on earth , from any of the bottom 6 astral layers to give you another chance to reduce your karmic baggage -from the bottom 6 layers.<br />\n<br />\nif your karmic baggage is too high, you will take re-birth to suffer.<br />\n<br />\nthe field of brahmAn ( god ) , does not treat all the same.<br />\n<br />\nthis is why some are beautiful having brains who are respected , while some are ugly lepers with NIL brains who are despised .<br />\n<br />\nUNLIKE WHAT FAKE GURUS HAVE BEEN SPREADING-- YOU ( SOUL ) ARE FORGING YOUR DESTINY ON YOUR OWN TERMS WHILE ON PLANET EARTH .<br />\n<br />\nonce you evolve and become human, you do NOT take re-birth as an animal .<br />\n<br />\nTHERE IS NO HEAVEN AND HELL CONCEPT IN HINDUISM.<br />\n<br />\nHINDUS MUST CREMATE THE DEAD BODY--<br />\n<br />\nWHILE THE BODY BURNS , YOUR SKULL POPS AND CREATES A PERSONAL TSUNAMI WAVE ( SOLITION CARRIER WAVE ) AND YOUR SOUL RIDES UP TO ANY OF THE 6 ASTRAL LAYERS .<br />\n<br />\nno other soul trapped on earth can take a piggy back ride .<br />\n<br />\nif your skull does not pop your eldest son must break your skull with a heavy rod to generate that soliton wave while being cremated.<br />\n<br />\nIF YOU ARE BURIED ( LIKE MUSLIMS/ CHRISTIANS/ VEERASHAIVAS ) YOU ( SOUL ) IS TRAPPED ON EARTH FOREVER --TO BE MISERABLE AND LOST.<br />\n<br />\nWHEN YOU DO NOT HAVE EGO, YOU ARE BURIED AFTER DEATH -- LIKE SAGES , AND SMALL CHILDREN OF LESS THAN 27 MONTHS OF AGE.<br />\n<br />\nSANATANA DHARMA URGES YOU TO SHED YOUR EGO AND LEAD A SIMPLE LIFE WHILE ON EARTH.<br />\n<br />\nYOUR EGO IS YOUR ( SOULs ) GREATEST ENEMY.<br />\n<br />\nEVOLUTION IS YOUR ( SOULs ) EVOLUTION UP THE LADDER -- TO THE 7 LAYERS.<br />\n<br />\nEVOLUTION IS NOT MAD MAN CHARLES DARWINs BULLSHIT THEORY OF MAN TO MONKEY.<br />\n<br />\nCONSCIOUS ANIMALS ELEPHANT, BONOBOS, DOLPHINS etc ARE IN LINE TO BECOME HUMAN AFTER DEATH.<br />\n<br />\nconscious animals can see colour and can see themselves in the mirror.<br />\n<br />\nwe do shraddh for our dead parents after death , so that your parents soul can get one layer lift propelled by , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">With busted sinus, whales lose their ability\nto echo-navigate,. They cant dive below water due to severe head pain and are dead,\nand remain on the surface. Winds and currents then beach the crippled mammal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Mind you, whales and dolphins are mammals .\nLike human beings they depend on the Hindu king mantra frequency of OM or 7.83\nhertz and its harmonics.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">VISHNUs FIRST MATSYA AVATAR WAS A DOLPHIN. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">EVEN TODAY PREGNANT WOMEN WHO ALREADY HAD\nDELIVERED BABIES WITH CEREBRAL PALSY , USE DOLPHINS WAVES TO HEAL THE BABIES IN\nTHE WOMB.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">THE MODERN MEDICAL WORLD WILL UNDERSTAND ALL\nTHIS ONLY AFTER 500 YEARS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/05/vishnu-first-matysa-avatar-dolphins-and.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/05/vishnu-first-matysa-avatar-dolphins-and.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The reason why whales lose their acoustic\nsense of direction is because the air held in the cranial air sinuses serves\nunderwater not only to generate but also to reflect, focus, and channel their\nreturning biosonar clicks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Without the right volume of air in each\ncranial air space, their acoustic navigation system quits working.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The rapidly changing air volumes inside their\nheads might do other damage such as force closed the eustachian tube or snap a\nbone that plays an important part in biosonar function. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Much can go wrong when the volume of air in\nthe sinuses and middle ear cavities bounces back and forth too excessively.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Sinus barotrauma is the slightest, most\ndeadliest internal injury any diving mammal can receive and still look\noutwardly healthy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-b1VoD9OYWF0/VpS7n2JmABI/AAAAAAABDO8/CdIjNw7d8mU/s1600/bareeeotrauma_for_web.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"428\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-b1VoD9OYWF0/VpS7n2JmABI/AAAAAAABDO8/CdIjNw7d8mU/s640/bareeeotrauma_for_web.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Compassionate animal lovers will try to puch\nback the whale into the sea or deeper waters, but the whale is unable to dive\ndue to PAIN.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-E5bffOwmWHo/VpS7-BoJqII/AAAAAAABDPE/9fSu_W7obQY/s1600/Mask_Squeeze_vv-_Barotrauma_Cropped.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
